comments.body: It should only obtainable in the fortress chests though.
yeah but if u dont have much or cant find a nether fortres
I do think that gold should be found but personally, I don't think it should be found in the nether
It needs to be a a challenge ninja just like how you would need to get more Obisidian for you portal, they would be found in the chests.

You can already find iron in Nether Fortresses, but I don't think it suits the dimension much. I would personally add a new and rare ore or resource in the Nether that can be used as a substitute for iron in flint and steel, crossbows (as Piglins wield them), etc. Maybe Ferrumite? (Ferrum being the Latin name for iron).

If Iron ore was in the nether, it would make looking for Netherite more rewarding, rather than collecting so much useless nether rack. Please add iron ore.... It can even be rare so as keep the game balanced.

you guys all have good points but you should check out my post on the same thing. I have a lot of valid points and I know you probably won't check it out so I just copied and pasted it here enjoy! :D

What I want is iron in the nether this would randomly generate and would be called volcanic scrap. This would drop iron nuggets, this would help out players that venture into the nether and make living in the nether much more sustainable. This would help players doing the start in the nether challenge by giving them the opportunity to craft iron gear and tools this would make nether exploration more desirable for newer players because they will always have access to iron armour and tools. Combine this with the ability to get ancient debris which after smelting they would be able to create a loadstone that would give newer players a way to explore the nether without fear of not finding there way back to their portal. And If their portal was not lit they could do some resource gathering and get a flint and steel. In conclusion, this would tempt newer players to explore the nether farther than they ever would before because It would eliminate many worries the nether has to offer. And be a great addition to Minecraft that would improve and create a more enjoyable nether exploration experience.
I believe that ore iron can rarely fall out of basalt. In real life, basalt is really rich in iron.

the tail could be crafted from 7 leather each enchanted with the aqua affinity and depth strider enchantments. also it should/could be separated from male and female skins. like if its a male skin it would be leggings rather then tail. the crafting recipe would be slightly different for the two.

example 

(1=leather/0=empty)

mermaid

111

010

111

 

merman

111

101

101

 

additionally when I mention should/could be separated by male and female skins, have a setting where the host can choose which one.

The tail should be crafted from 4 scutes, a conduit, and a heart of the sea. First, make a tail shape diagonally with the scutes. Then put the conduit on the top right corner and the heart of the sea on the bottom right corner.

This tail can be dyed any color, and makes you swim twice as fast as a dolphin, with water breathing for 100 minutes and once you put it on, your outfit changes to a bikini top or no shirt.

Steve= No shirt

Alex= Bikini top

Other skins= It depends on your arm width (slimmer arms get bikini tops, thicker arms get no shirt, as Steve and Alex are based that way)

Additionally, once the tail goes on land for more than one minute, it disappears, and you get your legs back. You have nausea after that for 30 seconds.

I love the idea, I would also like to increase damage further a mob, or player gets stuck into it, for example the player or mob should only take a half a health point when touching it, and maybe two hearts when touching the base of the block. negative potion effects such as poison aswell harming should be able to further increase damage to the player or mob aswell. Any drops would be instantly destoryed by the trap

They should be placeable on roofs to so we could make more types of spike traps
Have a same idea, too bad you didn't include any pictures of examples of such glass. If it did, there would be much bigger chance it would be popular, now we will probably never see new glass.

I really, really agree. It would also be really nice with glass panes. Maybe the recipe could be a log, concrete, terracotta or glazed terracotta surrounded by any glass. Making pane versions would just be the same recipe for normal panes, but with the framed glass. Perhaps Mojang could even add a new block which allows players to create different variants of blocks that are used in decoration to assist with the frames. It could be used for glazed terracotta and maybe the different prismarines. Plus other different blocks could be added for this new decoration block maker thing, maybe custom doors?

Also, beds with banners. :P

I was thinking iron ingots (I know iron can be expensive without an iron farm) for an iron frame that could give a more ‚Äúintricate‚Äù design on the panes but I like your idea too about the framed blocks with the wood too

I agree, it would be great. Currently we don't have framed windows, neither big modern windows, because you still have visible divisions on the current glass "walls". So, if framed windows were added, the current windows could be subdivided into grided, framed windows and flat, one piece windows.
Framed windows would still be quite useful in nether constructions, for they would be resistant to ghast attacks, when made of iron.
this has been added in so many texture packs over the years this is the number one thing builders want weather they realize it or not
I think this is wonderful for every wood type, color type and metal types all trimmed with glass of different colors

Why?  You have not convinced me in any way why it should be in Minecraft...

I agree to this but with incubators birds should be allowed to bread naturally like with a nest so like players can make a nest and sometimes nests can spawn randomly. Because well just going to quote jurrasic park 'life finds a way'

"can be a good thing or something"

You've got to give better reasons than that for including your idea. Why is it good from a gameplay standpoint?

I can see why making things renewable is a good idea, but I personally don't have a problem getting dirt.  Even without biome decimation, I find a lot of dirt while caving.  So for me, it's understanding that dirt is a valuable resource and I shouldn't be ignoring those dirt patches.

Dirt is technically renewable using coarse dirt.

If you hoe it, it turns into dirt so if you craft it using 2 dirt and 2 gravel you can hoe it into 4 dirt, so your turning gravel into dirt and you can duplicate gravel using gravity based farms.
I wouldn't call being able to duplicate gravel as gravel being renewable...  I seriously doubt any duplication ability is intended behavior.

Clarified subject to help search results.

Thanks for your contribution.
It would be awesome for a sky block
this would be very useful for repairing creeper holes and build certain things. dirt at the moment can only be renewed by getting podzol from a trader which is very inefficient

Definitely would be a good idea. Dirt isn't used often, but if you're making big farms, or like what Geminibros said, if you're playing skyblock, dirt can very quickly be used up. Plus (imo) it's not exactly fun to terraform all day and Rotten Flesh is barely used.

I came onto the Feedback website to suggest this very idea. I anticipate most requests for shears having fortune is to get more wool, and maybe this could also be a feature. However, fortune on shears to get more honeycomb is exactly what I was thinking.

The only foreseeable trouble I have is that it would be the first enchanted item that can operate in a dispenser / container. I think maybe you could only get the Fortune drops when a player is holding the shears, so as to simplify this application, balance it, and not create a precedent for enchanted items in redstone / containers. But that's just me. Overall, great idea!

I agree. It's a pain watching your Shears durability go down so low only to get very little wool or honeycomb out of it. Fortune 3 Shears would be a great addition

If you've ever played the game, and had a lot of dogs, you know how annoying it can be to have to make every single one stand up or sit down. It's just a pain in the butt, so please add this to both Java and Bedrock

Glad to see I'm not the only one who has thought of this!

In my mind, "using" the whistle (M2) commands any owned dogs nearby (except dogs leashed to players or fence posts) to carry out an action based on what the owner is aiming at:

  • Aimed at a block, dogs will attempt to move to and sit at or near the location
  • Aimed straight up, dogs will haphazardly follow the player (just like they do now)
  • Aimed straight down, dogs will follow the player single-file, mimicking every movement the player makes
  • Aimed at a mob or player, dogs will attack the targeted mob or player
  • Aimed at an item, dogs will "fetch" the item and bring it to the player
I love this idea. I constantly suffer with trying to get my dogs inside. Even if it just summons them to your location it will buy me time to shut the doors.
I would like a dog whistle way more if it teleported your dog to you up to 1000 blocks. If you wanted to go faster or if you lost your dog or something.
i would love to have this its a small but cool detail to go with the new dogs and it would be cool if they did a new item or even if they made the goat horns do this for another feature on those to
